node.title: Queensland borders will reopen to interstate COVID-19 hotspots from next Monday
node.alt: Premier Annastacia Palaszczuk addressed media conference on COVID-19
node.description: Queensland will open its borders to fully vaccinated travellers from interstate hotspots nextÂ Monday, Premier Annastacia Palaszczuk announces.
node.content:
["Queensland will open its borders to fully vaccinated travellers from interstate hotspots on 1:00am, Monday, December 13, Premier Annastacia Palaszczuk has announced.", "With\u00a078.67 per cent of Queenslanders over the age of 16 fully vaccinated, the state is opening up to the hotspots ahead of the scheduled December 17 date.", "From next Monday, double-dosed\u00a0travellers from hotspots \u2013 including New South Wales, Victoria and South Australia \u2013 will be able to arrive in Queensland via road or air.", "No quarantine will be required for the fully vaccinated, though travellers will need a negative COVID-19 test within the 72 hours before arrival.", "Anyone who is not fully vaccinated will need to arrive by air and undergo 14 days of hotel quarantine.", "The state will also drop a requirement for people to have waited two weeks after their second dose of a COVID-19 vaccine to be considered fully vaccinated.", "\"The national guidelines say one week is enough, so we will adopt the national guidelines,\" Ms Palaszczuk said.", "The state will now also require travellers from domestic hotspots to get a COVID-19 test five days after they arrive in Queensland \u2013 penalties will apply for people who do not.", "
'Special time' to reunite families
", "Ms Palaszczuk\u00a0said it was important to reunite families, especially in time for Christmas.", "\"This is going to be a very, very special time of the year and as a government we've been very conscious of how important this is, to reunite families,\" she said.", "The state recorded zero new community cases, and three cases were detected in hotel quarantine in the past 24 hours.", "Ms Palaszczuk said an update on the Omicron variant would be provided to National Cabinet on Friday.", "Queensland was to open its borders when 80 per cent of residents over the age of 16 were fully vaccinated.\u00a0", "\"We can't predict exactly when but we know it's going to be this week,\" Ms\u00a0Palaszczuk said.", "\"It's been nearly two years, tragically we've lost seven lives, but the results have been really unprecedented compared to the rest of the world,\" Ms Palaszczuk said.", "\"We fought back and contained nearly 50 outbreaks.\"", "
Border zone residents able to move freely across border
", "Ms Palaszczuk acknowledged travel restrictions had been very tough on border communities, and thanked them for their patience and understanding.", "\"From Monday, vaccinated border zone residents will be able to move freely across the border for any reason,\" she said.", "\"You will need a border pass and the border pass will run for 14 days \u2013 but you will not need a test.", "\"We know that it\u00a0has been extremely difficult for our border communities and we're hoping to provide some greater flexibility and freedom of movement for those communities.\"", "More to come."]
